definition: Syed Yousuf Raza Gilani (1952-), Pakistan People's Party politician, prime minister 2008-2012
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)

sentences.english: The prime minister was flying back to Islamabad from Lahore.
sentences.chinese: 吉拉尼总理当时正从拉合尔飞回伊斯兰堡。

sentences.english: Gilani held a grand welcome ceremony for Wen at the airport.
sentences.chinese: 吉拉尼在机场为温家宝举行了隆重的欢迎仪式。

sentences.english: Prime Minister Gilani and President Bush also discussed the global food crisis.
sentences.chinese: 吉拉尼总理和布什总统还讨论了全球粮食危机。

sentences.english: He is scheduled to meet with President George Bush on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 吉拉尼计划下星期一跟布什总统会谈。

sentences.english: Prime Minister Gilani and President Bush also discussed the global food crisis. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 吉拉尼总理和布什总统还讨论了全球粮食危机。

sentences.english: In the last days of Ramazan, Mr Gilani invited the foreign media for a dinner.
sentences.chinese: 在过去两天的拉马，他吉拉尼邀请外国媒体的晚餐。

sentences.english: The clash on the border came as Pakistan’s prime minister, Yousaf Raza Gilani, traveled to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 此次冲突发生时恰逢巴基斯坦总理吉拉尼在北京访问。

sentences.english: The Pakistani Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani said the perpetrators would not escape punishment.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦总理吉拉尼表示，迫害者最终难逃惩罚。

sentences.english: I believe his visit will further promote China-Pakistan relations.
sentences.chinese: 相信吉拉尼总理此访将推动中巴关系进一步向前发展。
